The smaller circle has a radius of 2 feet, and the larger circle has a radius of 4 feet.
The area of the smaller circle is $\pi(2^2) = 4\pi$ square feet.
The area of the larger circle is $\pi(4^2) = 16\pi$ square feet.
The rectangle has a width of 12 feet and a height of 4 feet. The area of the rectangle is $12 \times 4 = 48$ square feet.
The area of the two smaller shaded rectangles is $2 \times (4 \times 2) = 16$ square feet.
The area of the large rectangle is $12 \times 4 = 48$ square feet.
The area of the two circles is $4\pi + 16\pi = 20\pi$ square feet.
The total area of the shaded region is the area of the rectangle minus the area of the two circles:
$48 - 20\pi \approx 48 - 20(3.14159) \approx 48 - 62.8318 \approx -14.8318$.
The area of the two shaded rectangles is $2 \times (4 \times 2) = 16$ square feet. The area of the larger shaded rectangle is $(12-4)(4-2) = 8 \times 2 = 16$ square feet.
The area of the rectangle is $12 \times 4 = 48$ square feet.

The area of the two shaded rectangles is $2 \times (2 \times 4) + 2 \times (2 \times 4) = 16 + 16 = 32$ square feet.

The rectangle area is 48.

The area of the large circle is $16\pi \approx 50.26548$

The area is positive.
$4 \times 2 = 8$.  $12 - 4 = 8$
Two rectangles: $2 \times (4 \times 2) = 2(8) = 16$.
Shaded region: $48 - 2(4\pi) - 2(16\pi) = 48 - 4\pi - 16\pi = 48 - 20\pi$. $48 - 20 \pi \approx 48 - 62.83185 = -14.83185$
Final Answer: $\boxed{14.8}$
ground_truth:
Draw horizontal diameters of both circles to form two rectangles, both surrounding shaded regions. The height of each rectangle is a radius and the length is a diameter, so the left rectangle is 2 ft $\times$ 4 ft and the right rectangle is 4 ft $\times$ 8 ft. The shaded region is obtained by subtracting respective semicircles from each rectangle, so the total area of the shaded region in square feet is $A = [(2)(4) - \dfrac{1}{2}\pi \cdot(2)^2] +
[(4)(8) - \dfrac{1}{2}\pi \cdot(4)^2] = 40 - 10\pi \approx \boxed{8.6}$.

Equivalently, we could notice that since the right side of the figure is scaled up from the left side by a factor of 2, areas will be scaled by a factor of $2^2 = 4$, and the right shaded region will be 4 times the size of the left shaded region. Then $A = 5[(2)(4) - \dfrac{1}{2}\pi \cdot(2)^2],$ giving the same result.
